Get started

Source: vignettes/get-started.Rmd
get-started.Rmd

Presuming that orgdata package has been installed, this is how you can start using the main function. Otherwise you can install the package using the code below.

if (!requireNamespace("remotes"))
  install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("helseprofil/orgdata")

Alternatively is to clone user startup files ie. seepafil.R via terminal from user branch.

git clone -b user https://github.com/helseprofil/orgdata

When cloning the user startup, run the codes in setup.R file once before using seepafil.R.

Aggregate all files

To aggregate all files under a specific group such as BEFOLKNING group.

library(orgdata)
df <- make_file("BEFOLKNING")
df

If you are satisfy with the output and no error is shown during the process, you could save the output as a .csv file with:

save_file(df, "BEFOLKNING")

If you are certain that the process has been controlled before and everything should be working correctly. You could save the output directly as a .csv file by:

df <- make_file("BEFOLKNING", save = TRUE)

Aggregate selected files only

Aggregating the whole files in a group could take a long time when there are many files in the selected group. You could select only specific file or files by selecting the KOBLID instead. The example below is for selecting one and few files respectively.

df <- make_file("BEFOLKNING", koblid = 4)
df <- make_file("BEFOLKNING", c(4,10,15))

Process files without aggregating

When there is a need to look at the file prior to being aggregated. You could specify argument aggregate as TRUE. You could also activate it globally via options.

df <- make_file("BEFOLKNING", aggregate = FALSE)

# Global option
op <- options() 
options(orgdata.aggregate = FALSE)
df <- make_file("BEFOLKNING")

By activating it globally using options, all proceeding processes will not be aggregated unless itâ€™s changed during function call or you reset the options if you have saved the default with op <- options().

options(op)
